questions.question_text: Which dataflow transformation does data sync (replication) reference, in an existing dataflow, to determine which Salesforce objects and fields are currently being extracted?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_integrate_register_transformation.htm&language=en_US&type=5

D
When setting up data synchronization (replication) in Salesforce, the system uses the sfdcRegister transformation to determine which Salesforce objects and fields are being extracted from the source org. This transformation registers the source org with the dataflow, allowing the system to track changes in the source data and update the target org accordingly.

A. edgemart is a transformation used to create an Analytic Dataset, which is a specialized type of data object optimized for high-speed analysis in Salesforce Analytics.
B. export is a transformation used to extract data from Salesforce and create a data file in a specific format, such as CSV or Excel.
C. sfdcDigest is a transformation used to calculate a summary value or metric based on a set of source data.

Thank you guys to highlight this out.!
you do not have any idea what are you talking about. It is sfdcDigest

discussion.content: Correct!
C is the correct one
C is correct

Option B (Assign the Manager role) might seem plausible, but it is essential to ensure that the Manager role does not include the "Create and Edit Analytics" permission to prevent lens creation. However, option C (Assign the Viewer role) is a more precise and straightforward solution as it inherently limits lens creation without requiring additional permission adjustments.

C definitely looks correct, but I have to say the wording is terrible.

The question states: "After adding the user to the app", however you are required to select a role (Manager, Viewer, Editor) during the process of adding a user, not after. However it can be changed after.

Users can also be added even if they have NO analytics permission set assigned. They would not be able to access the app but can still receive the app assignment. Crazy...

C makes the most sense, but all of it is pretty senseless.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer definitely C

The Viewer role in most analytics platforms provides read-only access to content, which means the user can view and interact with dashboards but cannot create or edit them. This role usually restricts users from performing any actions that could modify the content, such as creating or saving lenses.
Assigning the Editor or Manager role to the user would give them more permissions than required and allow them to create and save lenses, which is not the intended requirement.
The Use Analytics permission is a basic permission that grants access to the analytics features in the platform, but it does not control the level of access or permissions granted to users.

Selected Answer: C
You can create lenses in the Use Analytics permission (D). Question specifies no create or save lenses, so the answer is C
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_explorer_view_lens.htm&type=5
C is the correct answer. As it addresses the question of app sharing. D proposes that it is a licensing concern, which it is not.

Selected Answer: C

without the ability to create and save lenses.

I think C is the correct answer, as a Viewer role does not allow a user to save changes to existing dashboard, lenses, and dataset in the app (saving dashboard requires the appropriate permission set license and permission). A viewer can only explore datasets that the user has Viewer access to and save lenses to an app that the user has Editor or Manager access to.

A consultant is asked to configure a user to view a dashboard, within a designated app, without the ability to create and save lenses.
After adding the user to the app, which action should the consultant take to implement this requirement?

choices.C: Assign the Viewer role to the user.
choices.B: Assign the Manager role to the user.
choices.D: Ensure the user has the Use Analytics permission.

questions.question_text:
The Universal Containers Sales team is looking to build a dashboard that shows the total revenue from their top 10 accounts (based on revenue) and make it dynamic with the filters of the dashboard.
What two steps are required to accomplish this? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B: 
you want to total from their top 10 accounts ( 1 value based on 10 accounts ); you would use the grouping to see the revenue of each account of their top 10 accounts. 


D: 
This step makes the dashboard dynamic by allowing the results of the top 10 query to filter the other visualizations or queries in the dashboard. This ensures that the displayed information is always in sync with the top 10 accounts based on the selected filters.

A and C
